trans-unit.source: How to use the ShardMapManager for data-dependent routing, a feature of elastic databases for Azure SQL DB
trans-unit.target: How to use the ShardMapManager for data-dependent routing, a feature of elastic databases for Azure SQL DB

trans-unit.source: The ShardMapManager class provides ADO.NET applications the ability to easily direct database queries and commands to the appropriate physical database in a sharded environment.
trans-unit.target: The ShardMapManager class provides ADO.NET applications the ability to easily direct database queries and commands to the appropriate physical database in a sharded environment.

trans-unit.source: This is called data-dependent routing and it is a fundamental pattern when working with sharded databases.
trans-unit.target: This is called data-dependent routing and it is a fundamental pattern when working with sharded databases.

trans-unit.source: Each specific query or transaction in an application using data-dependent routing is restricted to accessing a single database per request.
trans-unit.target: Each specific query or transaction in an application using data-dependent routing is restricted to accessing a single database per request.

trans-unit.source: Using data-dependent routing, there is no need for the application to track the various connection strings or DB locations associated with different slices of data in the sharded environment.
trans-unit.target: Using data-dependent routing, there is no need for the application to track the various connection strings or DB locations associated with different slices of data in the sharded environment.

trans-unit.source: Rather, the <linkText>Shard Map Manager</linkText><title></title> takes responsibility for handing out open connections to the correct database when needed, based on the data in the shard map and the value of the sharding key that is the target of the application’s request.
trans-unit.target: Rather, the <linkText>Shard Map Manager</linkText><title></title> takes responsibility for handing out open connections to the correct database when needed, based on the data in the shard map and the value of the sharding key that is the target of the application’s request.

trans-unit.source: (This key is typically the customer_id, tenant_id, date_key, or some other specific identifier that is a fundamental parameter of the database request).
trans-unit.target: (This key is typically the customer_id, tenant_id, date_key, or some other specific identifier that is a fundamental parameter of the database request).

trans-unit.source: For applications using data-dependent routing, a ShardMapManager should be instantiated once per app domain, during initialization, using the factory call GetSQLShardMapManager.
trans-unit.target: For applications using data-dependent routing, a ShardMapManager should be instantiated once per app domain, during initialization, using the factory call GetSQLShardMapManager.

trans-unit.source: The method ShardMap.OpenConnectionForKey(key, connectionString, connectionOptions) returns an ADO.Net connection ready for issuing commands to the appropriate database based on the value of the key parameter.
trans-unit.target: The method ShardMap.OpenConnectionForKey(key, connectionString, connectionOptions) returns an ADO.Net connection ready for issuing commands to the appropriate database based on the value of the key parameter.

trans-unit.source: Shard information is cached in the application by the ShardMapManager, so these requests do not typically involve a database lookup against the Global Shard Map database.
trans-unit.target: Shard information is cached in the application by the ShardMapManager, so these requests do not typically involve a database lookup against the Global Shard Map database.

trans-unit.source: The key parameter is used as a lookup key into the shard map to determine the appropriate database for the request.
trans-unit.target: The key parameter is used as a lookup key into the shard map to determine the appropriate database for the request.

trans-unit.source: The connectionString is used to pass only the user credentials for the desired connection.
trans-unit.target: The connectionString is used to pass only the user credentials for the desired connection.

trans-unit.source: No database name or server name are included in this connectionString since the method will determine the database and server using the ShardMap.
trans-unit.target: No database name or server name are included in this connectionString since the method will determine the database and server using the ShardMap.

trans-unit.source: The connectionOptions enum is used to indicate whether validation occurs or not when delivering the open connection.
trans-unit.target: The connectionOptions enum is used to indicate whether validation occurs or not when delivering the open connection.

trans-unit.source: ConnectionOptions.Validate is recommended.
trans-unit.target: ConnectionOptions.Validate is recommended.

trans-unit.source: In an environment where shard maps may be changing and rows may be moving to other databases as a result of split or merge operations, validation ensures that the cached lookup of the database based on a key value is still correct.
trans-unit.target: In an environment where shard maps may be changing and rows may be moving to other databases as a result of split or merge operations, validation ensures that the cached lookup of the database based on a key value is still correct.

trans-unit.source: Validation involves a brief query to the local shard map on the target database (not to the global shard map) before the connection is delivered to the application.
trans-unit.target: Validation involves a brief query to the local shard map on the target database (not to the global shard map) before the connection is delivered to the application.

trans-unit.source: If the validation against the local shard map fails (indicating that the cache is incorrect), the Shard Map Manager will query the global shard map to obtain the new correct value for the lookup, update the cache, and obtain and return the appropriate database connection.
trans-unit.target: If the validation against the local shard map fails (indicating that the cache is incorrect), the Shard Map Manager will query the global shard map to obtain the new correct value for the lookup, update the cache, and obtain and return the appropriate database connection.

trans-unit.source: The only time that ConnectionOptions.None (do not validate) is acceptable occurs when shard mapping changes are not expected while an application is online.
trans-unit.target: The only time that ConnectionOptions.None (do not validate) is acceptable occurs when shard mapping changes are not expected while an application is online.

trans-unit.source: In that case, the cached values can be assumed to always be correct, and the extra round-trip validation call to the target database can be safely skipped.
trans-unit.target: In that case, the cached values can be assumed to always be correct, and the extra round-trip validation call to the target database can be safely skipped.

trans-unit.source: That may reduce transaction latencies and database traffic.
trans-unit.target: That may reduce transaction latencies and database traffic.

trans-unit.source: The connectionOptions may also be set via a value in a configuration file to indicate whether sharding changes are expected or not during a period of time.
trans-unit.target: The connectionOptions may also be set via a value in a configuration file to indicate whether sharding changes are expected or not during a period of time.

trans-unit.source: Notice that rather than using a constructor for a SqlConnection, followed by an Open() call to the connection object, the OpenConnectionForKey method is used, and it delivers a new already-open connection to the correct database.
trans-unit.target: Notice that rather than using a constructor for a SqlConnection, followed by an Open() call to the connection object, the OpenConnectionForKey method is used, and it delivers a new already-open connection to the correct database.

trans-unit.source: Connections utilized in this way still take full advantage of ADO.Net connection pooling.
trans-unit.target: Connections utilized in this way still take full advantage of ADO.Net connection pooling.

trans-unit.source: As long as transactions and requests can be satisfied by one shard at a time, this should be the only modification necessary in an application already using ADO.Net.
trans-unit.target: As long as transactions and requests can be satisfied by one shard at a time, this should be the only modification necessary in an application already using ADO.Net.

trans-unit.source: The method OpenConnectionForKeyAsync is also available if your application makes use asynchronous programming with ADO.Net.
trans-unit.target: The method OpenConnectionForKeyAsync is also available if your application makes use asynchronous programming with ADO.Net.

trans-unit.source: Its behavior is the data-dependent routing equivalent of ADO.Net's Connection.OpenAsync method.
trans-unit.target: Its behavior is the data-dependent routing equivalent of ADO.Net's Connection.OpenAsync method.

trans-unit.source: A best practice in developing data access applications in the cloud is to ensure that transient faults in connecting to or querying the database are caught by the app, and that the operations are retried several times before throwing an error.
trans-unit.target: A best practice in developing data access applications in the cloud is to ensure that transient faults in connecting to or querying the database are caught by the app, and that the operations are retried several times before throwing an error.

trans-unit.source: Transient fault handling for cloud applications is discussed at [Transient Fault Handling](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn440719\(v=pandp.60\).aspx).
trans-unit.target: Transient fault handling for cloud applications is discussed at [Transient Fault Handling](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn440719\(v=pandp.60\).aspx).

trans-unit.source: Transient fault handling can coexist naturally with the Data Dependent Routing pattern.
trans-unit.target: Transient fault handling can coexist naturally with the Data Dependent Routing pattern.

trans-unit.source: The key requirement is to retry the entire data access request including the using block that obtained the data-dependent routing connection.
trans-unit.target: The key requirement is to retry the entire data access request including the using block that obtained the data-dependent routing connection.

trans-unit.source: Transactional properties are guaranteed for all operations local to a shard.
trans-unit.target: Transactional properties are guaranteed for all operations local to a shard.

trans-unit.source: For example, transactions submitted through data-dependent routing execute within the scope of the target shard for the connection.
trans-unit.target: For example, transactions submitted through data-dependent routing execute within the scope of the target shard for the connection.

trans-unit.source: At this time, there are no capabilities provided for enlisting multiple connections into a transaction, and therefore there are no transactional guarantees for operations performed across shards.
trans-unit.target: At this time, there are no capabilities provided for enlisting multiple connections into a transaction, and therefore there are no transactional guarantees for operations performed across shards.
